Sometimes you have to hunt for dinner, sometimes it is enough to put the muzzle to the ground, and sometimes you can eat up… waste.

What would the world look like backwards and what can a freak eat?  Check it out by playing "Eat Me!"

"Eat me!"  is a card game which, thanks to its funny convention, will familiarize the youngest players with the rules of consumption in force in nature.  The players arrange the "food chains" from the cards in accordance with the rules of nature - predators eat herbivores, and those, as vegetarians, eat plant food.  The game is enriched by action cards, which, for example, undo the player's movement, or the order of placing cards.  The person who gets rid of all cards in their hand wins.  The manual includes two additional gameplay variants: "Menu for the whole week" and "Everyone is very hungry".

Name: Kakerlacula Mitbringspiel
Description:
In the co-operative game Kakerlacula, players need to light all the candles in the rooms of the haunted castle — but Kakerlacula is dashing through the hallways trying to scare the children and force them to leave.

Players start the game with a number of garlic tokens, and on a turn, you launch one of the cockroach tokens on a catapult to see how it lands: Can you walk through the corridors, or will the cockroach scurry from one symbol to the next? If the cockroach crosses your path, you lose a garlic token. Can you complete your mission before you run out of garlic?

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Starbuck Promo
Description:
Kara Thrace "STARBUCK" promo from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter.

New Lieutenant with + 3 to hit modifier.

Talents:
- Daredevil
- Nimble Pilot
- Quick reactions
- Towing
- Marksman
- Troubleshooter
- Inspiring
- Religious

Flaws:
- Alien Spacecraft

Note: It is the same card as found in Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles â€“ Starbuck: Captured Raider, but without the ship.

Name: Code On
Description:
A pathogen is causing a pandemic! Scientists are mystified as to which gene is causing global fatalities, provoking you to start a quest to uncover the pathogenic gene sequence. The genetic processes of mutation and indels hinder your discovery progress. Utilise your intellect, together with the powers of base sequencing and CRISPR base editing technologies, to correctly reveal the pathogen gene sequence. Crack the pathogenic code to enable scientists to develop a vaccine to save humanity from an impending health crisis.

During each turn, players have to guess a hidden part of the pathogen genetic sequence. With every guess, the player is granted information about how accurate their guess was. Using deduction and reasoning skills, player record this information and use it to get closer to cracking the true genetic sequence!

Each turn, players can opt to use one of their wildcards, which can either help (Helper cards) them or hinder (Hinder cards) their opponents discovery progress. Play these cards wisely though, as you are only limited to a couple per game!
A player wins when they crack the full hidden genetic sequence!

Can you crack the genetic code?

—description from the publisher

Name: Maiden's Quest: Snuzzler Dragon Savior Promo Card
Description:
Maiden's Quest: Promo – Snuzzler Dragon from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter

New Savior Card with one gem on the Left behind side and 2 gems and downgrade a haste on the Saved side

Name: Maiden's Quest: Morgan of Draknor Savior Promo Card
Description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter.

New Savior Card with the Flip and Upgrade abilities.

Name: Sagas: Bretland
Description:
We are in the 800s. The Anglo-Saxons of Bretland are living peaceful lives, unaware of the imminent danger that is coming. Hundreds of Warriors and Shield Maidens from all over Scandinavia are sailing for the mainland, setting foot for the first time ever on English soil. Led by the most powerful Viking leaders, they set about raiding and pillaging everything in their way. Their goal is simple: Gather as much wealth, land, and fame as possible to become the next Great Viking Leader.

Sagas: Bretland is a game for two to four players where each player forges their saga as they raid Bretland in search of wealth, land, and fame.

Starting with a small raid party on the shores of Bretland, each player will explore the land, expand their colonies, gather resources, and raid Anglo-Saxon settlements while battling any other Viking leaders that may stand in their way.

At the end of the 8th round, the player with the most victory points wins Sagas: Bretland. These can be earned by building new Viking villages, raiding existing Saxon settlements, raiding other player’s settlements, and completing specific objectives.

Who will be the next Great Viking Leader?

—description from the publisher
